Name: Shabti of Psamtek-em-akhet
Description: Upper part of a shabti of Hor-sa-iset called Psamtek-em-akhet. The figure holds hoe and pick, with basket over left shoulder, and wears a striated wig with long lappets, and a long artificial beard of the type worn by gods. The lines of hieroglyphic inscription gives, after the names of the man, the shabti formula, summoning the figure to carry out any hard manual tasks for him in the afterlife. Shabtis of this size and date are amongst the finest, most detailed faience objects produced in Egypt.
